snippet: Mohamed Soltan, who has been incarcerated for more than a year since his arrest at a street protest, wrote to his family on his 27th birthday.
abstract: Mohamed Soltan, Egyptian-American imprisoned in Cairo, enters 294th day of hunger strike; Soltan, who has been awaiting trial for more than a year after his arrest at a street protest, writes letter smuggled to his family describing his ordeal.
lead_paragraph: Mohamed Soltan, who has been incarcerated for more than a year since his arrest at a street protest, wrote to his family on his 27th birthday.

headline.main: From an Egyptian-American Prisoner on Hunger Strike in Cairo, a Letter Home
headline.print_headline: From Prison in Cairo, Story of a Long Fast
